metadata.title: CVE-2021-30744 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Description: A cross-origin issue with iframe elements was addressed withimproved tracking of security origins. This issue is fixed in tvOS 14.6,iOS 14.6 and iPadOS 14.6, Safari 14.1.1, macOS Big Sur 11.4, watchOS 7.5.Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross sitescripting.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.32.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.32.3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
